conclusion: Analyze the image and problem description to determine if light beam b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light beam a.

The image shows a hemispherical glass brick with its flat surface labeled AB, positioned horizontally. The center point C is marked as the midpoint of AB. Perpendicular to AB through C is line OO'. Two light beams, a and b, are incident perpendicularly onto the flat surface AB from air at points equidistant from C. Both beams intersect at point P inside the glass brick.

Diffraction occurs when light encounters an obstacle or an edge, causing it to bend around the obstacle. Refraction occurs when light passes from one medium to another with a different optical density.
Both beams a and b enter the glass brick perpendicularly, indicating they are subject to refraction as they pass from air into the glass. Their paths are symmetrical.

Due to the symmetry in the setup, the likelihood of diffraction at the interface AB is the same for both beams a and b. Diffraction is more likely to occur at the edges of the glass, not at the point of refraction.
Given the symmetry of the setup and the fact that both beams intersect at the same point, light beam b is not more likely to exhibit diffraction than light beam a.
